text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the consent test as the first step in the jurisdictional analysis for host-state counterclaims. It details how consent can be derived (expressly, impliedly, or via an ad-hoc agreement) and provides specific case examples (*CMS Energy v. Argentina*, *Saluka v. Czech Republic*, *Waste Management v. Mexico*) illustrating how tribunals interpret broad BIT wording (like \u201cany dispute concerning the interpretation or application of this Agreement\u201d) to determine if implied consent exists for a state counterclaim.
